attributes.action: Deny Turkish government-sponsored rallies in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Follow the governments of Germany and the Netherlands in denying access to members of the Turkish government from addressing Turkish expat communities across Europe.

attributes.action: Pay Child Maintenance To Single Parents Only
attributes.background: Child Maintenance should be paid ONLY to single parents as when they start another relationship or get married, their income increases.
attributes.additional_details: The paying parent has new relationship children taken into account on their earnings, so why shouldn't the receiving parents partner's income be also taken into account as they are now supporting the children.

attributes.action: Make healthy food cheaper and put the price up on junk food
attributes.background: I'm a Type 2 diabetic and I need to eat a healthy low carb diet but healthy food is so expensive so I tend to buy what I can afford. I have 4 children and a husband to feed as well and they don't eat healthy either because of the cost.

attributes.action: Wales is part of the UK so the Welsh flag should be included on the Union Flag.
attributes.background: I am often asked by pupils where I work why the national flag of Wales is not included on the Union Flag. Wales is a member of the UK and should be represented on it's flag. This could easily be done by adding the Welsh flag in a corner of the Union Flag. Wales deserves to be represented.

attributes.action: Close down schools that breach the Equality Act.
attributes.background: There are schools that teach homophobia, sexism and racism under the guise of 'religion'. This is indoctrination and harassment, directly in breach of the Equality Act. It creates a hostile environment for children and attacks protected characteristics. This is breaking the law.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/editorials/illegal-faith-schools-education-ofted-a7587621.html
Any school that is breaking the Equality Act is an 'illegal school'. All schools need to be rigorously inspected. Downgrading them is not enough. They need to change or be closed. They are breaking the law.
http://www.pinknews.co.uk/2016/12/21/christian-schools-downgraded-by-ofsted-over-homophobic-teachings/

attributes.action: Make it illegal for insurance companies to ask about non fault incidences/claims
attributes.background: Insurance premiums are sky high already. It is totally unfair that insurance companies ask about these incidences and charge higher perimiums as a result. They already charge the driver who was at fault a higher premium, why do they also need to penalise the driver who was innocent! This is unfair
attributes.additional_details: These incidents have to be declared for 5yrs! A non fault accident can cause higher premiums for driver for 5 whole years! My insurance was £1400 this year with a £1350 excess because of 3 non faults in the last 5 years with a 5yr ncb. It looks set to remain this high for 5years, maybe even go up next year. It would have been £700 otherwise. People are reduced to not reporting things and sorting it out themselves. Or worse, forced off the road. They have us over a barrel and abuse this power.

attributes.action: Repeal the fixed term parliament act, hold elections, reform the House of Lords
attributes.background: The HOL reform has been promised for years and needs to be acted upon not sidelined, especially when those with vested interests in institutions such as the EU are not debarred from casting votes.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for bank and building societies to allow gambling on credit card
attributes.background: I think it should be illegal to gamble on credit cards as it allows vulnerable people to easily get into debt with money that they should have never been allowed to gamble with. People with the addiction can easily use the full amount of credit chasing the previous bet they lost. Puts lives at risk
attributes.additional_details: Please support this, many people need your help. Not only gambling money they can't afford but hiding the truth from people who truly care about them. Making them feel depressed and not knowing where they can turn.

attributes.action: Do not deport Commonwealth Soldiers who served in The British Army Reserve.
attributes.background: Please allow Foreign & Commonwealth Soldiers the automatic right to remain in the UK after four years of service. Don't sanction them to make an application within 28 days to the Home Office or they face deportation, this is an act of injustice.
attributes.additional_details: We fight for Queen & Country so we deserve better.

attributes.action: Repeal the Fixed Term Parliaments Act 2011
attributes.background: The Fixed Term Parliaments Act should be repealed immediately to allow an opportunity to call a snap election. With several obstacles on the horizon for the government, a general election will most likely strengthen its hand and reaffirm the voters support and representation.

attributes.action: Put the risks of having a cot bumper in the SIDS guidelines.
attributes.background: There is many stories out there that cot bumpers are unsafe and can cause death e.g suffocation and strangulation. If this were in the SIDS guidelines parents are made aware of the risks before and after there baby is born.
attributes.additional_details: Prestons Story

attributes.action: Remove home address from driving licences.
attributes.background: Driving Licences are numbered so all information can be found by bodies who need to do so.  Carrying your address around with you is not secure.

attributes.action: The police should have proper foot patrols once again.
attributes.background: The number of police patrols I see has dwindled, I feel proper police foot patrols around towns and streets would prevent most petty crimes happening (as a police force should be a preventative force and not a reactive force).

attributes.action: Ban local councils from using unfair camera cars.
attributes.background: Dropping someone off at bus stop and a camera car catches you get a £55 pound fine these cars are unfair if you appeal all you get is you should not have done it.

attributes.action: School Admissions: Get your child into a school of your choice.
attributes.additional_details:
Two in five local councils have do not have enough school places meaning that there are an increasing number of children not getting into schools of their choice. 

This pressure on the shortage of school places is contributing to larger class sizes and children having to travel further to attend school. 

This petition is a call for unified planning, by the government, to ensure there are enough different types of schools and most importantly school places for our children.

attributes.action: Share/Stakeholder,hedge fund,& companies using robots should pay social care tax
attributes.background: Share/stake holders who receive over £50,000 in dividends, hedge funds, and companies that replace workers with automation often fail to reinvest their profits in the workforce and payrates. As the workforce pays taxes, these companies are also depriving the Government of taxes and NI contributions.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should therefore introduce a new 'Social care tax' on share and stake holders, hedge funds, and companies who use automation. The Government must only use this income for social care.  It would help county councils tackle shortages in their social care budgets without making cuts elsewhere, including council tax rises. This tax would also help the NHS with their budget sort falls.

attributes.action: Stop Council Household Waste Recycling Centres charging for any domestic waste.
attributes.background: Councils are increasingly starting to charge for waste deemed as non-household waste despite deriving from a household. This includes, rubble, plasterboard, sanitary ware, drainage pipes etc.This is not cost effective and will increase the amount of fly tipping.This excludes commercial derived waste
attributes.additional_details:
Staffordshire county council charge £6 to dispose of a toilet with cistern. 
£3 per bag of rubble or plasterboard. etc view their website for more details. 

Councils should aim to encourage recycling and correct disposal of waste, not discourage it by charging.

attributes.action: Start a television awareness campaign aimed at children about dangers and safety
attributes.background: Tv ads in the 80's made children aware for stranger danger and general health and safety..this is absent in today's society and needs re- addressing for adults and children

attributes.action: Invite the king of Holland to a state visit.
attributes.background: The people of Holland have a lot in common with the people of the UK. They speak English as standard. And I think it would unify us as a great leading trade partner.

attributes.action: calling for a law to place a cap on rent increases on Public Houses and Venues
attributes.background: Companies that lease out or rent Public Houses and venues keep raising the rent to extortionate levels to push out publicans who pour Their life, blood and sweat into keeping these places open but the rent keeps increasing. and this needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details: I have seen so may Pubs close due to huge rent increases that cripple publicans and force them to close the doors after years sometimes even Decades of trading all because a company decides that the rent should increased in some cases doubled to levels that are un-achievable in the current economic climate. I ask that a cap be put on these rent increases to enable publicans to keep the doors open.

attributes.action: Sugar Tax: Government to re-debate Sugar Tax and potentially scrap Sugar Tax
attributes.background: Debate to consider: undesirable side effects of artificial sweeteners (AS); aspartame approved at current levels of consumption. Levels may increase due to ST; choice to consume natural product (sugar); tax from ST to research health impact of AS and fund nutrition education
attributes.additional_details: The Sugar Tax compromises and demonizes the use of a natural substance and promotes synthesized products. Sugar has been used for centuries to sweeten food. We know the side effects of its excessive consumption. In comparison, artificial sweeteners are a new phenomenon. Not enough conclusive research has been carried out for the Government to decree that sweeteners are a healthy alternative to sugar. For example, research into aspartame concluded it is both safe and a potential source of cancer.

attributes.action: Delay British Summer Time by 1 day in 2017
attributes.background: British Summer Time starts on Mothering Sunday in 2017 meaning that the poor hardworking mothers of the UK lose an hour of their special day. This is so wrong and a smack in the face for all mothers.

attributes.action: Provide option to transfer from current student loans to future alternative loan
attributes.background: The government indicated in 2014 that an alternative loan would be available this year but it's still in development. Students who cant take interest based loans should not be discouraged from going to university and have the option to take current loan but be able transfer into the alternative loan

attributes.action: Abolish Business Rates - Make The Difference in VAT to make UK more competitive.
attributes.background: From high-street retailers to SMEs attempting to grow, Business Rates are a burden that can only be overcome by charging more, making them less attractive compared to online retailers and imports. These rates have no bearing on the revenue of a business, and absolutely nothing is provided in return.
attributes.additional_details:
Moving business rates to VAT will level the playing field for SME's, rather than penalize UK firms for being in the UK. Often mistakenly compared to council tax, business rates are archaic and do not include refuse collection or any other service, and takes precedence over any other bill - it is deemed a statutory debt without any compromise that can lead to businesses filing for bankruptcy.
https://www.retail-week.com/topics/5049347.article
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3123850

attributes.action: That the government suspends Foreign Aid for 3 years to fund social care
attributes.background: Approx £12bn was spent in foreign aid in 2015. The biggest recipient Pakistan has nuclear weapons! This cash could be used to fund a social care program that cares for the elderly, disabled and those with mental health issues. Bed blocking costs the NHS approx £900m a year.
attributes.additional_details: Patients cannot be discharged because they are unable to cope at home alone without care.This puts huge pressure on the NHS and puts seriously ill patients at risk. Budgets in elderley, disabled and mental health care are being continually cut thereby forcing people back into the NHS system. The problem will continue to get worse as the population lives longer and budgets are squeezed even harder. This cash could be used to create a sustainable social care plan to address these issues

attributes.action: Ban Chewing Gum from being sold in the UK. Make towns cleaner and healthier.
attributes.background: No matter where you go in the UK, most towns and cities will have areas that have a high level of chewing gum spread across pavements and walkways. Not only is unsightly, embarrassing and spreads germs. It costs councils lots of money to sort out. Money that could be used elsewhere i.e. NHS etc.

attributes.action: Stop our Government sending financial aid to China, India and Mexico.
attributes.background: This Petition is asking the Government to re-think the idea of sending financial aid to China, Mexico and India.
attributes.additional_details:
It has been widely reported in the media that our Government is planning to spend £1.3 billion UK tax payers' money on the improvement of social care for the elderly of China, India and Mexico.  
This Government and others have eroded our Military, we have thousands of people living on the streets, our NHS is in severe crisis, our schools are over populated and our own elderly live in fear of significantly high heating bills. This is so wrong! I would ask that the Government looks after the citizens of the UK who are in need and let other countries look after their social care.

attributes.action: Make transgender people be able to use the bathroom they feel comfortable with.
attributes.background: its wrong that people feel like they are forced to enter bathrooms that they do not feel comfortable with. This makes them stressed out and can increase their dysphoria. It shouldnt be right to stop people from being comfortable with themselves

attributes.action: Anyone fly-tipping should lose their driving licence and have vehicle crushed
attributes.background: We live in a beautiful country and it's disgraceful to see people getting away with fly-tipping. Instead of fines if there is evidence from the public filming the offence then crush the offending vehicle and ensure the driver is banned from driving, and give them a community order to clear rubbish.

attributes.action: Review the current deportation system, and address its surrounding concerns.
attributes.background: Review gov. process of deportations, particularly through charter flights; address their impact on detainees. Address the impact of deportation centres, especially on children. Address lack of care for legal proceedings and claims before deportations. Address violence and racism on charter flights.
attributes.additional_details:
People subject to the UK deportation system are in a vulnerbale place, and there are many issues which need to be addressed.

I have written an article with references: http://writingco.tumblr.com/post/157272986629/secretive-night-flights-the-uks-un-reviewed 

Most powerful sources: http://www.medicaljustice.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/state-sponsored-cruelty.pdf & http://www.refugeecouncil.org.uk/what_we_do/childrens_services/working_with_age_disputed_children/children_in_detention

attributes.action: Increase the Marriage Tax Allowance
attributes.background: At present more marriage tax relief is afforded couples in their 80s and 90s, than on all other marriages including those caring for young children. Whilst we should of course care for our elderly, we should give a significant married tax break to young families who also need our help.
attributes.additional_details: Philip Hammond under pressure to increase marriage tax allowance: http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/01/16/philip-hammond-pressure-increase-marriage-tax-allowance/

attributes.action: Government has to replace EU funding for rare diseases
attributes.background: There are over 6000 rare diseases that Rare Disease Day recognise that need ongoing research and funding. By leaving the EU I wish to ensure that the funding remains in place. My son has PVNS which needs continued funding.
attributes.additional_details: http://ec.europa.eu/research/health/pdf/ri_projects_factsheet.pdf#view=fit&pagemode=none

attributes.action: PE should not be a core subject in secondary school!
attributes.background: Some students get bullied in PE because they're not good at doing the activities they are told to do e.g running, and some students are not confident enough to do PE. I personally think that PE should not be a core subject, it should be our choice if we want to study this subject or not.
attributes.additional_details: As a GCSE student, I don't think that P.E is going to help us in the future unless we want to become a PE teacher, personal trainer, Athlete etc. Therefore, we should have the right to choose.

attributes.action: Reject Brexit If The UK Fails To Maintain Access To The Single Market
attributes.background: The EU countries make up 53% of  imports and 44% of British exports. Leaving the European Union would put Britains position in the single market in doubt meaning the introduction of tariffs on trade. This would mean an increase in prices of imported products and less foreign investment.

attributes.action: Ban councils from stopping neighbouring residents from using recycling centres
attributes.background: Councils have started issuing permits to use recycling facilities.  Thus residents cannot always now use the closest facility, increasing their journey length causing more pollution and discouraging them from recycling.
attributes.additional_details: Example.  Sandhurst residents now must take a 16 mile round trip to Longshot Lane instead of 6 mile round trip to Frimley Road.

attributes.action: Back the British Pound with gold and / or silver.
attributes.background:
Many people are alarmed at the voracious rate of money printing or QE here in the UK (& elsewhere). This is nothing more than a ponzi scheme & this one will end in disaster soon.
We need to get ahead of the game & back our currency with gold/silver before others steal the lead on this.
attributes.additional_details:
Web. www.hiddensecretsofmoney.com
Web. www.sprott.com
Book. When Money Dies. Adam Ferguson.
Book. The Silver Manifesto. David Morgan.
Book. The Big Reset. Willem Middelkoop
Organisation. GATA (Gold Anti Trust Action Committee)

attributes.action: Create ban for 5.5+ tonne lorries using the outside lane on dual lane motorways
attributes.background: Create enforceable ban on lorries 5.5 tonnes and over using the outside lane on dual lane motorways, to be especially strict during heavy commuting hours. It causes a huge risk to public safety with exaggerated accordion effects and shunt crashes due to high closing speeds. Also slows down traffic!
attributes.additional_details: The M42 is a good example. Between the M6 at Birmingham and the M1 south, lorries pull out whenever they please causing massive queues and shunt crashes during 'rush hour' times. This needs to stop!

attributes.action: Take the National Lottery license away from Camelot.
attributes.background: Camelot is not a British company. The profits go to its owners in Canada. Since taking possession of Camelot they have changed the odds and made it harder to win and invented the useless 'FREE LUCKY DIP' Prize. The whole game needs an overhall with more smaller prizes to keep in interesting.
attributes.additional_details: When the National lottery first started it had a jackpot of £8million every Saturday and even the Wednesday draw generated a £6million prize. Now it is less than 1/2 of this because people have lost interest/faith in the current set up. They doubled the ticket cost and that put even more people off, then reduced the chance of winning even a small prize. Now the only way it generate interest is with roll-overs created because not enough people play to win the prize

attributes.action: S106 money for sport equally divided; mens, womans and childrens involvement.
attributes.background: Funding for sport through Section 106 can disproportionately advance male dominated sports and not benefit the whole community. This money should be used to support women and children to access sports also and any money used must show how it can equally support sport for all.

attributes.action: Change lottery back to £1 and 49 balls also the operator Camelot has ruined it
attributes.background: Since lottery was changed your chances of winning are 45 million to 1 rather 14 million to 1 also  the doubling off the price and cutting the amount off 20,000 raffles down from 50 off  to 20 off and the prize fund needs look at example when you got 5 numbers and only got £15 and 3 numbers got £25
attributes.additional_details:
The odds of winning the lottery with 59 numbers
 the new rules, the pool of numbers for players to choose from will increase from 49 to 59. At the moment, players choose six numbers up to 49, with odds of winning the jackpot sitting at just under one in 14 million. These will lengthen to around one in 45 million from Saturday
Punters with five winning numbers in Wednesday's Lotto draw ended up with just £15.

attributes.action: Random and unannounced illegal drug testing for all members of parliament.
attributes.background: Random drug testing has become common place within the UK workplace. From the Police to factory workers to warehouse operatives to administration clerks. This same deterrent must be actioned to test the people who hold one of the most important roles in the country whose decisions affect society.

attributes.action: Make Kirkby part of Lancashire again.
attributes.background: Historically Kirkby, a town mentioned as far back as the Domesday Book was part of Lancashire, until being acquired by the Liverpool corporation in 1947. I believe, Kirkby would truly be a prosperous place if it was taken away from Merseyside and returned to its rightful place as part of Lancashire.

attributes.action: Tougher sentences for theft of tools from vans and  people that sell them
attributes.background: After having my vehicle broke into twice in the same amount of weeks I think it's about time the government did something to deter these thieves

attributes.action: Start a new online lottery to fund the National Health Service in the UK
attributes.background: Due to the disastrous state that the National Health Service finds itself in today it is essential that extra funding is found. The Health Lottery only funds local issues, a new National Lottery for this purpose would seem ideal.

attributes.action: Allow people to invest their Pension Funds in residential property.
attributes.background: Currently people who have SIPPS and SSAS Pension Funds are prohibited from investing in residential property and can only invest in commercial. Allowing residential property purchase would unlock investment in rental housing which would then overtime reduce the cost of rental property.
attributes.additional_details:
It is acknowledged the concerns about pension funds purchasing the homes of scheme members and we therefore accept the need for regulations to prevent this.
However, the unintended consequences of the way that the current regulations are drafted is that the sector is potentially being deprived of significant and stable investment. Investors are instead being driven to potentially more risky buy-to-let investments, or not into housing at all.

attributes.action: Protect all natural physical and mental characteristics under the Equality Act.
attributes.background: Today's society and cultural norms are swarmed by double standards. It is a criminal offence to discriminate somebody due to their ethnic origin, sex etc, but it is socially acceptable to discriminate somebody because of their hair colour, height and other genetic traits. In 2017, this has to stop.
attributes.additional_details: In a developed nation, you would expect all kinds of discrimination to have been abolished. Only decades ago it was both legally and socially acceptable to mock and discriminate someone due to their sexual orientation. It is only recently that society and the government have start to come to it's senses and understand discrimination's devastating consequences. This must be applicable to all, so everyone can feel accepted and valued without having to battle unnecessary judgement and insecurity.

attributes.action: Establish a mandatory retirement age of 2 years for UK Beagles in Animal Testing
attributes.background: Beagles one of the most intelligent loving dogs around  were forced to inhale cigarette smoke in the 70s and in labs are still subjected to live in tiny cages and forced to inhale weed- killers, pesticides and other toxic substances. In California a bill has been passed and can the UK do the same?
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.express.co.uk/news/world/476866/WATCH-Freed-beagles-play-outside-for-the-first-time

http://www.onegreenplanet.org/news/bill-that-requires-labs-to-retire-cats-and-dogs-from-testing-passed-in-california/

attributes.action: Enforce Big Pharma to contribute N% of annual profits to Mental Health in U.K.
attributes.background:
As a young person with a history of mental health difficulties I know just how hard it is to receive the quality treatment from the NHS I need to make a strong sustainable recovery.  

With government cuts abound, it is well overdue for the industry benefiting from the rise in diagnoses to pay up!
attributes.additional_details:
We are facing an unprecedented level of mental health crises in the U.K. 

With an ever growing demand for hospital beds and meds, we need a rapid and concerted effort from industry, government and charity to reduce the level of serious incidents and proactively 'maintain', not 'manage' the nations mental health. 

This will be only be achieved through new innovative legislature which targets the unrivalled profits from pharmaceutical companies and rebalances their private corpate interests.

attributes.action: Create public bonds that pension funds etc' can invest to build owned homes too.
attributes.background: The recent addition of bonds to enable buy-to-let creation doesn't help facilitate a proper meritocracy. More proper for a 50-50 split in terms of building policy choice. This policy seems like a government giving up on the future of truly independent living to appease the big house builders.
attributes.additional_details: We know that the big 5 housing companies are holding onto roughly 476,000 planning permissions, artificially inflating housing prices and have been doing so for decades. I say this policy is just as monopolistic in tendency as the recent energy, rail ticketing and Fifa bribes scandals. This isn't about morals, this is about conservative Hayek based free-market systems. Unfortunately, a state sponsored 'eye' is required to help maintain proper market function from time to time.

attributes.action: Abolish all speed limits on the M6 toll road
attributes.background: The M6 toll road is a private road and road users have to pay to use it. The police should have no authority to generate funds from drivers who ignore the 70mph limit as hello this is a private road.
